title: ReSeed and FoodChain ID Announce Ground-Breaking Partnership That Promotes Transparency for Sustainable ... - PR Newswire
summary: FoodChain ID and ReSeed have partnered to enhance transparency in carbon credit verification for sustainable practices in the agri-food supply chain, addressing the significant greenhouse gas emissions from the industry. This partnership aims to incentivize farmers to adopt regenerative agriculture practices and comply with EU deforestation regulations, while providing efficiencies through combined audits. ReSeed will utilize technology for data collection, whereas FoodChain ID will conduct independent audits for credibility in measuring carbon sequestration. This initiative seeks to promote a healthy planet and support farmers' livelihoods through improved sustainability.

summary: A recent study shows that a global shift towards plant-based diets can significantly improve human and planetary health by reducing greenhouse gas emissions, land use, and water pollution. title: Don't Believe What Consumers Say When It Comes to Sustainability - The Business of Fashion
summary: The article discusses the disconnect between consumers' expressed desire for sustainable fashion and their actual purchasing behavior, highlighting a gap between surveys and reality. It examines factors like poorly constructed surveys, intention versus action discrepancies, the complexity of defining sustainability, vested interests in sustainability claims, and the flawed premise that buying more sustainable products can lead to overall sustainability. Despite findings that suggest a market for sustainable products is growing, consumer behavior during events like Black Friday contradicts this trend.

summary: Grab Malaysia, in collaboration with KLEAN, F&N, and MRANTI, has launched AI-driven Reverse Vending Machines (RVMs) in the Klang Valley to promote recycling and reduce packaging waste by 2040.
